person.persName: William Thompson Scott (Lexington, Kentucky, and Frankfort, Kentucky, soldier and inventor)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, and Frankfort, Kentucky, trader, soldier, and inventor. Lexington native. Trader in Lexington in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as lieutenant colonel from October 1861 to July 1862. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as colonel from July 1862 to December 1862. Resigned on December 7, 1862. Paymaster general of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1863 to 1865. Invented the Triplett & Scott repeating rifle with Lewis Triplett, patented in December 1864.
